docs.snippet: Republican presidential nominee Donald Trump acknowledged on Thursday that his campaign was struggling in Utah, a usually rock-solid Republican state, on a day in which he briefly set aside his self-confidence for a rare display of doubt....
docs.lead_paragraph: Republican presidential nominee Donald Trump acknowledged on Thursday that his campaign was struggling in Utah, a usually rock-solid Republican state, on a day in which he briefly set aside his self-confidence for a rare display of doubt.

headline.main: Trump Acknowledges Tough Fight in Usually Republican Utah
headline.print_headline: Trump Acknowledges Tough Fight in Usually Republican Utah

docs.snippet: The two neighbors have failed to make progress toward ending the civil war....
docs.lead_paragraph: The two neighbors have failed to make progress toward ending the civil war.
docs.abstract: Editorial laments failure of meeting between Russian Pres Vladimir V Putin and Turkish Pres Recep Tayyip Erdogan to achieve any meaningful progress towards resolving Syria's civil war; notes increasingly deteriorating conditions in Aleppo and Russia's ongoing duplicity in claiming to want political solution.

headline.main: What Russia and Turkey Bring to Syria
headline.print_headline: What Russia and Turkey Bring to Syria

docs.snippet: Senate Majority Leader Mitch McConnell said Thursday that GOP prospects for keeping control of the Senate after the November elections are "very dicey," sounding an alarm amid mounting Republican concerns about presidential nominee Donald Trump,...

headline.main: McConnell: GOP Chances to Keep Senate Are 'Very Dicey'
headline.print_headline: McConnell: GOP Chances to Keep Senate Are 'Very Dicey'

docs.snippet: Hillary Clinton and Donald Trump offer voters distinct choices this fall on issues that shape everyday lives. Actual ideas are in play, as difficult as it can be to see them through the surreal layers of the 2016 presidential campaign....

headline.main: WHY IT MATTERS: All Will Be Touched by Choice in November

docs.snippet: THE ISSUE: About 9 in 10 Americans now have health insurance, more than at any time in history. But progress is incomplete, and the future far from certain. Millions remain uninsured. Quality is still uneven. Costs are high and trending up again. ...
docs.lead_paragraph: THE ISSUE: About 9 in 10 Americans now have health insurance, more than at any time in history. But progress is incomplete, and the future far from certain. Millions remain uninsured. Quality is still uneven. Costs are high and trending up again. Medicare's insolvency is two years closer, now projected in 2028. Every family has a stake.

docs.snippet: Hillary Clinton offered a selective accounting of her history on trade Thursday, leaving out her support for initiatives that have since become unpopular. She also offered a rosier view of the U.S. workforce than the numbers portray....
docs.lead_paragraph: Hillary Clinton offered a selective accounting of her history on trade Thursday, leaving out her support for initiatives that have since become unpopular. She also offered a rosier view of the U.S. workforce than the numbers portray.

headline.main: AP FACT CHECK: Clinton's Selective History on Trade
headline.print_headline: AP FACT CHECK: Clinton's Selective History on Trade

docs.snippet: Amateur psychoanalysts have put Donald Trump on the couch, calling him a sociopath, unhinged, a narcissist. Amid all this psych-talk, there is one group of people who aren't talking as much: the professionals. Or at least they're not supposed to....
docs.lead_paragraph: Amateur psychoanalysts have put Donald Trump on the couch, calling him a sociopath, unhinged, a narcissist. Amid all this psych-talk, there is one group of people who aren't talking as much: the professionals. Or at least they're not supposed to.

headline.main: Amateurs Analyze Trump's Mind, but Should the Pros Do It?
headline.print_headline: Amateurs Analyze Trump's Mind, but Should the Pros Do It?

docs.snippet: Politicians have often relied on the stories of those who have suffered to help move or change the minds of voters. But is it right to do so?...
docs.abstract: Politicians have often relied on the stories of those who have suffered to help move or change the minds of voters. But is it right to do so?
